tripiá¹­aka master Xuanzang respectfully received
up to the ignorance latent tendencies to be eliminated by cultivation in the formless realm.
Among the ninety-eight latent tendencies,
how many latent tendencies increase for each one?
Why is this treatise composed?
The answer is: in order to reveal the meaning of the chapters based on the previous ones.
That is, based on the previously explained forty-two chapters, it reveals the meaning of the ten kinds of chapters such as the latent tendencies and so forth.
Furthermore, in order to stop other schools and reveal the correct principle.
That is, some hold the view
that the eye faculties and other dharmas in the body of a post-learner are also uncontaminated.
In order to refute this view and show that the eye faculties and so forth are only contaminated, because they are increased by the latent tendencies.
Or, some hold the view
that the afflictions and inversions have no real objects.
In order to refute this view and show that the afflictions have real objects.
Or, some hold the view
There is no meaning of bondage through association with objects.
If there were a meaning of bondage with regard to objects,
then one would be bound by taking the uncontaminated dharmas as objects.
If there were a meaning of bondage through association,
then even after one has eliminated them, one would still be bound.
In order to refute this view, it is shown that there is a meaning of bondage through association with objects.
As for bondage through objects,
it only exists with regard to the contaminated, because the latent afflictions necessarily increase when they take them as objects.
Even though one takes the uncontaminated as objects, they do not increase, and therefore there is no meaning of bondage.
As for bondage through association,
it is necessary that the associated afflictions have not yet been eliminated.
Even though there is association after the afflictions have been eliminated, there is no meaning of bondage.
Moreover, in order to refute those who are bound but who give rise to the conceit of superiority, thinking they are liberated,
it is said that they temporarily subdue the afflictions,
but they claim that they have attained liberation for themselves.

One wants to make them understand that even with regard to their own eyes, etc., there are still latent afflictions such as craving that increase.ğŸ”½Moreover, in order to extensively discriminate the meaning of the sutras,

That is, a sutra says that in the eye faculty and so forth, various latent afflictions increase. Although this is said, it is not extensively distinguished.
Now, in order to distinguish, this treatise is composed.
It should be known that there are five categories of dharmas here.
They are the five categories of latent afflictions that increase.
As for the five categories of dharmas,
they refer to dharmas that are to be eliminated by seeing suffering, up to dharmas that are to be eliminated by cultivation.
It should be known that the five categories of latent afflictions are also like this.
Here, dharmas that are to be eliminated by seeing suffering are followed and increased by all latent afflictions that are to be eliminated by seeing suffering,
and by the universal latent afflictions that are to be eliminated by seeing the arising of suffering.
Dharmas that are to be eliminated by seeing the arising of suffering are followed and increased by all latent afflictions that are to be eliminated by seeing the arising of suffering,
and by the universal latent afflictions that are to be eliminated by seeing suffering.
Dharmas that are to be eliminated by seeing the cessation of suffering are followed and increased by all latent afflictions that are to be eliminated by seeing the cessation of suffering,
and by the universal latent afflictions.
Dharmas that are to be eliminated by seeing the path are followed and increased by all latent afflictions that are to be eliminated by seeing the path,ğŸ”½and by the universal latent afflictions.
and the pervasive latent afflictions that increase with it.
The dharmas to be eliminated by cultivation are increased by all the latent afflictions to be eliminated by cultivation,
and the pervasive latent afflictions that increase with it.
Next, there are ten kinds of dharmas,
which are increased by nine kinds of latent afflictions.
The ten kinds of dharmas are:
The dharmas to be eliminated by seeing suffering, origination, cessation, and the path, each have two kinds:
The first is associated,
and the second is not associated.
The dharmas to be eliminated by cultivation also have two kinds:
The first is defiled,
and the second is undefiled.
The nine kinds of latent afflictions are:
The latent afflictions to be eliminated by seeing suffering and origination each have two kinds:
The first is pervasive,
and the second is not pervasive.
The latent afflictions to be eliminated by seeing cessation and the path each have two kinds:
The first is with contaminated objects,
and the second is with uncontaminated objects.
And the latent afflictions to be eliminated by cultivation,
are collectively nine kinds.
Among them, the associated dharmas to be eliminated by seeing suffering,
It is increased by all the latent afflictions eliminated by seeing suffering and by the pervasive latent afflictions eliminated by seeing the origin.

according to circumstances, there is the bondage of the object and the bondage of association.

there is only the bondage of the object.

Next, there are forty-one kinds of dharmas.
They are further increased by thirty-six kinds of latent afflictions.
The forty-one kinds of dharmas are:

The thirty-six kinds of latent afflictions are:

If one explains the inclusion of dharmas, one should rely on the eighteen elements.
If one explains the various consciousnesses, one should rely on the twelve sense bases.
If one explains the various knowledges, one should rely on the four noble truths.
If one explains the various latent tendencies, one should rely on the five categories.
Now, because it explains the latent tendencies,
it distinguishes the differences in the increase of the latent tendencies according to the five categories.
The eye faculty is increased by the universal latent tendencies of the desire realm and form realm,ğŸ”½and by the latent tendencies eliminated by cultivation.

The faculty of pleasure increases with all the contaminants of the form realm and the universal contaminants of the desire realm,

The faculty of joy increases with all the contaminants of the form realm and the desire realm,
except for doubt and the ignorance associated with it that take the uncontaminated as their object.
The remaining contaminants all increase it.
The faculty of joy is found in both the desire and form realms, and exists in only three stages.
Namely, the desire realm and the first and second meditative absorptions.
In the desire realm, it is associated with the five classes of afflictions.
It is not associated with the latent tendencies of anger and doubt.
Because it arises with the mode of activity of delight,
while anger and doubt arise with the mode of activity of dejection.
Delight and dejection are mutually exclusive and not associated.
In the desire realm, the faculty of joy excludes doubt and ignorance associated with it that are eliminated by seeing cessation and the path.

Doubt and ignorance associated with it that are eliminated by seeing cessation and the path.
With regard to the faculty of joy, they are not bound as objects, because they take the undefiled as their object.
They are not bound as associates, because they are not associated.
Although the remaining doubts and anger are not associated,
they do have the meaning of being bound as objects with regard to the faculty of joy.
Therefore it is said that in the desire realm, the faculty of joy excludes doubt that takes the undefiled as its object,
and ignorance associated with it.
The remaining latent tendencies all increase.

The defiled one is associated with the five classes and is associated with all the latent tendencies.
Doubt in the stage of concentration is also associated with joy and pleasure.
Because each of them increases all the latent tendencies of their own stage.

The three undefiled faculties are not increased by the latent tendencies.
Because all undefiled dharmas are not increased by the latent tendencies.
Why is this?
If a dharma is the object of the view of self,ğŸ”½it is the object of perversion,
it is the object of the latent tendencies,
and it is the place where craving, hatred, and delusion can stand.
That which is defiled, stained, and turbid
is increased by the latent tendencies.
The undefiled dharmas are not like this.
Therefore they are not increased by the latent tendencies.
Moreover, where there is craving, that place is where the latent afflictions increase.
Like a damp and oily place where dust and dirt easily adhere.
The pure dharmas are not like this.
Therefore, they are not increased by the latent afflictions.
Moreover, if a dharma is grasped by the view of self as the self or what belongs to the self,
that place is where the latent afflictions increase.
The pure dharmas are not like this.
Moreover, if a dharma is the object-support of the latent afflictions
and is also the object of increase,
then it is increased by the latent afflictions.
Although the pure dharmas are the object-support of the latent afflictions, they are not the object of increase,
so they are not increased by the latent afflictions.
Moreover, if a dharma is the object-support of the latent afflictions
and is also the place of increase,
then it is increased by the latent afflictions.
Although the pure dharmas are the object-support of the latent afflictions,
they are not the place of increase, so they are not increased by the latent afflictions.
The Venerable PÄrÅ›va said:
Uncontaminated dharmas are smooth and pure, and the various latent afflictions cannot find a foothold in them.
Therefore, they are not increased by the latent afflictions.
It is like a very smooth and pure lapis lazuli.
Mosquitoes, flies, and other insects cannot find a foothold in it.
The Venerable Vasumitra says:
Uncontaminated dharmas are burning hot, and the various latent afflictions cannot find a foothold in them.
Therefore, they are not increased by the latent afflictions.
It is like a burning hot ground where one cannot find a foothold.
The Venerable Suvará¹‡a says:
Uncontaminated dharmas are powerful, and the latent afflictions take them as their objects but do not increase.
It is like the son of a candÄla who, when looking at the face of a powerful king, becomes extremely frightened in his mind.
The Venerable Vasu says:
When latent afflictions arise in relation to contaminated dharmas, the latent afflictions gradually increase.
It is like a person looking at the moon, and the eye faculty becomes enhanced.
Therefore, contaminated dharmas are increased by the latent afflictions.
When latent afflictions arise in relation to uncontaminated dharmas, the latent afflictions gradually decrease.
It is like a person looking at the sun, and the eye faculty becomes damaged.
Therefore, pure dharmas are not increased by the latent afflictions.
The eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body elements, the form, sound, and tangible-object elements, and the eye, ear, and body consciousness elements.

The truths of cessation and path are not increased by the latent afflictions.

However, regarding the conventional knowledge of all latent afflictions, there are two bonds in terms of objects and concomitance.
The four alternatives should be made.
There are latent afflictions that are bonds in terms of objects for conventional knowledge, but not bonds in terms of concomitance.
This refers to the views that take contaminated objects as their objects.
There are latent afflictions that are bonds in terms of concomitance for conventional knowledge, but not bonds in terms of objects.
This refers to the latent afflictions that take uncontaminated objects as their objects, excluding the views.
There are latent afflictions that are bonds in terms of objects and also bonds in terms of concomitance for conventional knowledge.
This refers to the latent afflictions that take contaminated objects as their objects, excluding the views.
This is the general explanation.
If the specific explanation is given,
if [a latent affliction] is a bond in terms of objects for that [conventional knowledge],

neither bonds in terms of objects nor bonds in terms of concomitance for conventional knowledge.

The Venerable Megha has a different four-part statement.
There are some latent afflictions that are bound by the object in relation to conventional knowledge, but not bound by association.
This refers to the latent afflictions of the same stage that have not yet been eliminated in relation to the view of conventional knowledge that takes the same stage as its object.
There are some latent afflictions that are bound by association in relation to conventional knowledge, but not bound by the object.

The remaining latent afflictions of the same stage that are not yet eliminated, which take conventional knowledge as their object, are also the same.
